title: Infernal or Hellfire Vi
body: I love you now Peter Guo. Please Riot?!!?!?! Please for the love of the game and Vi?!

All that possible infringement

> All that possible infringement

-looks at every other champion with at least one skin that's a reference that might be borderline infringement-
{{champion:85}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:126}}{{champion:30}}{{champion:10}}{{champion:127}}{{champion:99}}{{champion:11}}{{champion:21}}{{champion:82}}{{champion:75}}{{champion:58}}{{champion:268}}{{champion:76}}{{champion:51}}{{champion:107}}{{champion:68}}{{champion:35}}{{champion:27}}{{champion:8}}{{champion:112}}{{champion:14}}{{champion:5}}{{champion:59}}{{champion:23}}{{champion:15}}{{champion:16}}{{champion:57}} {{champion:50}}{{champion:17}}{{champion:412}}{{champion:18}}{{champion:4}}{{champion:29}}{{champion:45}}{{champion:62}}{{champion:101}}{{champion:157}}

Hmm.....

Are we calling Shen borderline infringement?

I mean...

> [{quoted}](name=CalciferHowel,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pJVqz31R,comment-id=000600010000,timestamp=2014-12-12T21:39:32.668+0000)
> Are we calling Shen borderline infringement?
> 
> I mean...

No, I said " with at least one skin that's a reference that might be borderline infringement"

Yellowjacket Shen and Frozen Shen. IE: Scorpion and Sub-Zero from Mortal Kombat

Right, he's saying Shen is far past borderline in that it's a very non-subtle reference and if Netherrealm Studios took it to court, they'd have a better case than, say, DC Comics would in the case of Super Teemo or Ubisoft would in the case of Talon.

If Nightblade {{champion:39}} doesn't have *major* references to a *major* game franchise... I don't know what to think. There are a lot of champ skins to pay homage to comic book and video game characters. I'm pretty sure that Rito knows well enough on how to make the reference obvious, but not so much as to make it a blatant copyright infringement.
Xerath?
I'm not familiar with most of these champs and their skins in which you would be referring to.
Yeah I'd have to agree with this.  They could do an Infrenal Vi, nobody can copyright horns, red skin, or even a big stone fist.  But THAT particular big stone first is clearly HB's.

Nope. HB's stone fist doesn't have the molten effect inbetween the cracks. This one is just cracked stone with molten lava between. It's literally the difference between light and dark. Furthermore, Hellboy only has one stone fist, "shaves" his horns, doesn't have that much hair, his hair is the opposite color, he dresses far less provocatively, and does not have reddish orange eyes or white lips.

It's an obvious reference, and the stone fist is as close as you can get to a shout out without being a copy. But I say it's not a copy. Riot's artists could probably do a better job of avoiding controversy by making it look more unique.

*The rest of my post is not in response to you*

Although the blatant fanservice is strong with this image.

To the creator of this artwork: It's nice, it really is, but STOP TAKING THE VERY FEW CONSERVATIVELY DRESSED CHAMPIONS AND SKANKING UP THEIR OUTFITS SO THAT THEY LOOK JUST LIKE ALL THE OTHERS. You are diminishing what makes those champions unique. It's childish, embarrassing, and rude.
Man shut the fuck up. Youre as fucking childish as conservative muslims.
While I agree that Mr. Tentacle (oddly ironic name, given the circumstances) needs to realize that Vi has long ago been subject to Rule 34, going full racist is a nono.

You're singling out conservative Muslims as being childish+While Islam is technically a religion, it's generally only associated with those of Middle Eastern and a relatively small African descent=Racist comment. Or do you need me to explain in more basic terms?

> THE VERY FEW CONSERVATIVELY DRESSED CHAMPIONS

*Looks at Officer Vi skin, and then back to your post* Something doesn't add up here......

Sexy, but trying to tear Hellboy from Mavel is going to be a challenge...

> [{quoted}](name=Tough Guy,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pJVqz31R,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2014-12-13T01:13:28.834+0000)
> Sexy, but trying to tear Hellboy from Mavel is going to be a challenge...

IIRC, Hellboy is owned by it's creator Mike Mignola, who has a publishing deal with Dark Horse but has all the rights to the character.

Not that Riot would have to do that at all. It's similar enough that people can see it's an homage, but different enough it could never end in a lawsuit unless someone had a patent on all depictions of demonic creatures, or stone gauntlets.
